- there were almost no corporate events of any kind until 2018 (when I left), although I heard this started to change afterwards
- no internal job application portal

pros:
You get paid on a monthly basis.

Easy access to a gentlemen’s club next to their new office.
cons:
Leadership and management are bullies and will lie to cover their own mistakes.

Staff turnover is very high, if you survived 2 years congratulations as you haven’t been managed out yet or pushed out yet. Leadership has a report as to who has been in the company less than 2 years as a firing list, as you have no employment rights.

Lots of positive reviews here are due to HR actively encouraging you how amazing the place is and that you should write a glassdoor review whilst you are within your probation period aka honeymoon period.

Most people are looking to leave as the environment is toxic.

job_title: Technical Helpdesk Analyst in Guadalajara, Jalisco
pros:
As a Technical Help Desk analyst you wont get that call center feeling anymore. Depending on the campaign you are put in your job basically requires to provide assistance to employees that have technical issues such as; 
-Password Reset
-Technical help with Hardware (Computer, peripherals, software)
-The people you are speaking on the phone are great people, they are friendly and courteous. 

Now the company does have Fondo de ahorro (Matched savings plan) that is given late July to all employees. They do offer paid Holidays and have the ability to give the option to work from home, but only after you meet a certain criteria (Metrics and location).
-Great co-workers
cons:
-The pay is not that great (Pay is the same with all campaigns including the ones where you are back to back).
-Team leads don't take the time to show knowledge e.g. Learning how to set Internet Explorer as default in Windows.
-Agents have to rely on Knowledge articles know as KB's, but the majority of KB's don't have enough information for you to be able to correct customer's issue. 
-The Stars reward program is non existent (I have received 0 points for the past 8 months)
- CPUs and Monitors are outdated and in bad shape (consistent computer issues), and you have to make up time for it.

review_title: As bad as the bad reviews suggest
pros:
* Lovely offices
* Jars of chocolates, fresh fruit and treats left lying around every day
* Entry pay seems high
* High focus on socials
* Superficially 'diverse' but only in the junior roles, which is where you will stay forever
cons:
Work - if you are an IT/Digital, Telco specialist and have no interest in real business transformation then this is the place for you! They will sell it to you hard as a proper consultancy but actual, genuine business consultancy assignments are as rare as rainbow unicorn eggs, in other words they don't exist. They will tell you how they can compete with the big boys but this is simply a lie, it is all IT/Digital. There is nothing wrong with this but only join if your area of expertise is technical and telco.

The bench - recently this has started to be managed in a draconian way where consultants are forbidden from seeking consulting leads and generating their own work. Anyone who has worked in any other consultancy will know that this is a bizarre and frankly cretinous way of operating. The only reason this could be happening is to maintain a list of those who could be culled when the time comes because they can be identified as idle/useless. There are legendary tales of people being left on the bench for up to a year through no fault of their own.

Promotion - This is and it has been said before 'an old boys club'. It was set up by a group of Telco friends who only initiate other Telco, white, male clones into the leadership team. There may be one or two ethnics in senior positions but diversity is just wear a BLM t-shirt day or come to an 'exciting' curry evening and that's it. The composition of the leadership team and who gets promoted tells its own story - the facts speak for themselves. 

Leadership - there isn't any, the leaders are mostly extremely poor with the best ones having left . Any successes gained over the last few years was comprehensively destroyed by a properly daft agile re-organisation which delivered zilch. A great example of how having a Harvard business qualification doesn't mean you can deliver anything. Last year they received 10s of millions of pounds in investment from their Japanese parent company which is basically the only thing that is propping it up.

Consulting - the small consulting team is is led as though everyone was back in their 6th form with jolly initiatives that are old fashioned and just useless and pointless in generating any extra work and worst still in training junior consultants on anything useful.

Culture - you will have to do some serious smoozing to get into the 'in crowd' which will at least guarantee the best projects and promotions for doing nothing particularly spectacular. Rewards are based on favouritism and if your face fits and if you are prepared to suck up to the disproportionately large number of incompetent directors and leaders.

review_title: Worst Company to work, pathetic environment
pros:
1. Company will provide you compensation more than market standards, but then they won't give you benefits, appraisals, hikes, bonus or promotion for years. For example, if someone is hired on 10 LPA as a developer and having experience of 4 years. Then its very high chances that his/her salary and position will remain same even after 10 years.
2. Another thing the organisation gives you is huge amount of tension, worries and high blood pressure.
cons:
Plenty of downsides for working this organisation

1. No policies or benefits for employees. 
2. No structure for hierarchy, your junior may become your boss or a team lead can be demoted and might be working under you. This is not one of the cases but that's the kind of environment is there in the organisation.
3. If you want to succeed here you have to be best in your politics, work skills are secondary thing.
4. After that you should have "Yes Boss" attitude i.e whatever your boss says you have to do that, you can't put up your point or suggest anything. If you don't have "Yes Boss" attitude you will be out of project or may be demoted or worse, may be out of organisation in no time.
5. Your feedback is in hands of your manager solely. Even if you want to change your project or account, your manager's feedback will be taken, and if your relation with your manger isn't great(beacause you didn't follow points 3 and 4 correctly) then you wont't get any projects, despite of recieving multiple appreciations from clients
6. In Salesforce domain, there is not much scope, as there are not many projects . So if you don't get any project or you are on bench for 2 months then you will be out without getting any notice.
7. Of course, no appraisal.
8. Very high micro management, even if you are working for 16 hours a day.
9. Few managers come to office just to use internet and watch Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hotstar, YouTube etc., and do micro management then. And these kind of managers are absolutely ZERO in project management and development skills.

Final statement, do not go to this organisation, espacially as a Salesforce developer as there is little to no growth but you will have to deal with a lot of politics.
